monogr.title: A discovery of the Barmudas, otherwise called the Ile of Diuels : by Sir Thomas Gates, Sir George Sommers, and Captayne Newport, with diuers others. Set forth for the loue of my country, and also for the good of the plantation in Virginia. Sil. Iourdan

div.head: TO THE RIGHT WORshipfull Master IOHN FITZIAMES Esquire, one of his MAiesties chiefe Iustices of Peace within the Countie of DORSET.
div.p:
SIR, Amongst all the sinnes, that humane nature doth stand possest with, ingratitude, doth challenge a propertie in man, although it bee a thing repugnant to reason, and disagreeing with all mutuall focietie. To free myselfe from this vitium naturae, I am bold in these fewe lines to dedicate my loue to you: for it were
too tedious to vse many wordes, where good wil is the bond of loue. This smal gift I would intreate you to accept, if not for the quantitie, yet for the qualitie.

closer.dateline: From London the thirteenth of October, 1610.
closer.signed: Your Worships to commannd, SIL. IOVRDAN.
